sentence: Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) will begin trading ex-dividend on July 19, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.69 per share is scheduled to be paid on August 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased PG prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 3.14% increase over prior dividend payment.
At the current stock price of $87.55, the dividend yield is 3.15%.
The previous trading day's last sale of PG was $87.55, representing a -4.84% decrease from the 52 week high of $92 and a 7.85% increase over the 52 week low of $81.18.
PG is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Unilever NV ( UN ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
PG's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $5.46.
Zacks Investment Research reports PG's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 5.13%, compared to an industry average of 9.6%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the PG Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
